TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit CookieContainer extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides a container for a collection of objects.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer> is a data structure that provides storage for instances of the <xref:System.Net.Cookie> class, and which is accessed in a database-like manner. The <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer> has a capacity limit that is set when the container is created or changed by a property.
An instance of the <xref:System.Net.Cookie> class is added to the container based on its originating URI. It is added to an internal <xref:System.Net.CookieCollection> associated with the URI. A <xref:System.Net.Cookie> is retrieved from the container based on the URI as a <xref:System.Net.CookieCollection>, or as a string that can be used to submit HTTP WebRequests.
The <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer> has three properties that govern the volume of the content of the container: <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Capacity%2A>, <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.MaxCookieSize%2A>, and <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.PerDomainCapacity%2A>. These values have the default settings of 300, 4096, and 20 respectively. When a <xref:System.Net.Cookie> is added to the container, these properties are used to determine whether a <xref:System.Net.Cookie> already contained in the <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer> should be discarded to make room for the new one. The <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer> keeps track of each addition to ensure that neither the <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Capacity%2A> nor the <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.PerDomainCapacity%2A> limits are exceeded. If one or both are exceeded, then <xref:System.Net.Cookie> instances held by the <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer> are removed. First, any expired <xref:System.Net.Cookie> is removed. If further capacity must be recaptured, then the least-recently used <xref:System.Net.CookieCollection> is purged.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The default constructor initializes all fields to their default values. <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.DefaultCookieLimit> is used to initialize <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Capacity%2A>, <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.DefaultCookieLengthLimit> is used for <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.MaxCookieSize%2A>, and <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.DefaultPerDomainCookieLimit> is used for <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.PerDomainCapacity%2A>.

Docs.param: The to be added to the .
Docs.summary: Adds a to a . This method uses the domain from the to determine which domain collection to associate the with.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Count%2A> property equals or exceeds the <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Capacity%2A> property, one or more <xref:System.Net.Cookie> instances are removed from the container before adding the `cookie` parameter. Enough <xref:System.Net.Cookie> instances are removed to bring <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Count%2A> below <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Capacity%2A> as follows: if there are expired instances in the given scope, they are cleaned up. If not, then the least recently used <xref:System.Net.CookieCollection> is found and removed from the container.

Docs.exception: The domain for is or the empty string ("").

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Add(class System.Net.CookieCollection cookies) cil managed

Docs.param: The to be added to the .
Docs.summary: Adds the contents of a to the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Count%2A> property equals the <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Capacity%2A> property, one or more <xref:System.Net.Cookie> instances are removed from the container before adding the contents of the `cookies` parameter. Enough <xref:System.Net.Cookie> instances are removed to make room for `cookies` as follows: if there are expired instances, they are cleaned up. If not, or if more room is needed, then the least recently used <xref:System.Net.CookieCollection> is found and removed from the container.

Docs.summary: Adds a to the for a particular URI.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If you add a <xref:System.Net.Cookie> instance for just one specific host, do not set the <xref:System.Net.Cookie.Domain%2A> property of the <xref:System.Net.Cookie> instance. This is set automatically, based on the URI.
If your URI corresponds to your local domain and sends to all the hosts on the local domain, set the <xref:System.Net.Cookie><xref:System.Net.Cookie.Domain%2A> property equal to ".local". Otherwise, make sure it matches the host name used in the URI.
If the <xref:System.Net.Cookie.Version%2A> property of a <xref:System.Net.Cookie> is Netscape, the <xref:System.Net.Cookie.Path%2A> property of the <xref:System.Net.Cookie>, if not set explicitly, is derived from the URI and is the complete path from the URI, including the page name.
If the <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Count%2A> property equals the <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Capacity%2A> property, one or more <xref:System.Net.Cookie> instances are removed from the container before adding the `cookie` parameter. Enough <xref:System.Net.Cookie> instances are removed to bring <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Count%2A> below <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Capacity%2A> as follows: if there are expired instances in scope, they are cleaned up. If not, then the least recently used <xref:System.Net.CookieCollection> is found and removed from the container.

Docs.exception:
is larger than .
-or-
The domain for is not a valid URI.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If you add a <xref:System.Net.Cookie> instance for just one specific host, do not set the <xref:System.Net.Cookie.Domain%2A> property of the <xref:System.Net.Cookie> instance. This is set automatically, based on the URI.
If your URI corresponds to your local domain and sends to all the hosts on the local domain, set the <xref:System.Net.Cookie><xref:System.Net.Cookie.Domain%2A> property equal to ".local". Otherwise, make sure it matches the host name used in the URI.
If <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Count%2A> equals <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Capacity%2A>, one or more <xref:System.Net.Cookie> instances is removed from the container before adding the `cookie` parameter. Enough <xref:System.Net.Cookie> instances are removed to bring <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Count%2A> below <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Capacity%2A> as follows: if there are expired instances in scope they are cleaned up. If not, then the least recently used <xref:System.Net.CookieCollection> is found and removed from the container.

Docs.exception: The domain for one of the cookies in is .
One of the cookies in contains an invalid domain.

Docs.value: The number of instances that a can hold. This is a hard limit and cannot be exceeded by adding a .

remarks.format:
## Remarks If <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Count%2A> equals or exceeds <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Capacity%2A>, one or more <xref:System.Net.Cookie> instances are removed from the container. Enough instances are removed to bring <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Count%2A> below <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Capacity%2A> as follows: if there are expired <xref:System.Net.Cookie> instances in scope, they are cleaned up. If not, then the least recently used <xref:System.Net.CookieCollection> is found and removed from the container.
<xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Capacity%2A> must be greater than or equal to <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.PerDomainCapacity%2A>.

Docs.summary: Gets the number of instances that a currently holds.
Docs.value: The number of instances that a currently holds. This is the total of instances in all domains.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The default value of this property is <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.DefaultCookieLimit>. If <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Count%2A> equals or exceeds <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Capacity%2A>, one or more <xref:System.Net.Cookie> instances are removed from the container. Enough instances are removed to bring <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Count%2A> below <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Capacity%2A> as follows: if there are expired <xref:System.Net.Cookie> instances in scope, they are cleaned up. If not, then the least recently used <xref:System.Net.CookieCollection> is found and removed from the container.

Docs.summary: Represents the default maximum size, in bytes, of the instances that the can hold. This field is constant.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The default maximum <xref:System.Net.Cookie> size is 4096.

Docs.summary: Represents the default maximum number of instances that the can hold. This field is constant.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The default maximum number of <xref:System.Net.Cookie> instances is 300.

Docs.summary: Represents the default maximum number of instances that the can reference per domain. This field is constant.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The default maximum number of <xref:System.Net.Cookie> instances per domain is 20.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance string GetCookieHeader(class System.Uri uri) cil managed

Docs.param: The URI of the instances desired.
Docs.summary: Gets the HTTP cookie header that contains the HTTP cookies that represent the instances that are associated with a specific URI.
Docs.returns: An HTTP cookie header, with strings representing instances delimited by semicolons.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.GetCookieHeader%2A> returns a string that holds the HTTP cookie header for the <xref:System.Net.Cookie> instances specified by `uri`. The HTTP header is built by adding a string representation of each <xref:System.Net.Cookie> associated with `uri`. Note that the exact format of the string depends on the RFC that the <xref:System.Net.Cookie> conforms to. The strings for all the <xref:System.Net.Cookie> instances that are associated with `uri` are combined and delimited by semicolons.
This string is not in the correct format for use as the second parameter of the <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.SetCookies%2A> method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Net.CookieCollection GetCookies(class System.Uri uri) cil managed

Docs.param: The URI of the instances desired.
Docs.summary: Gets a that contains the instances that are associated with a specific URI.
Docs.returns: A that contains the instances that are associated with a specific URI.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A new instance of a <xref:System.Net.CookieCollection> is created. Then the <xref:System.Net.Cookie> instances in the internal collection that are associated with the specified URI are read out and added to the new <xref:System.Net.CookieCollection>.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the new value of <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.MaxCookieSize%2A> is less than the current value, any <xref:System.Net.Cookie> with a length that exceeds the new value will be truncated.

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the number of instances that a can hold per domain.
Docs.value: The number of instances that are allowed per domain.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the new <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.PerDomainCapacity%2A> value is less than the current value, and if any of the domain collections contain more <xref:System.Net.Cookie> instances than the new value, the collections are pruned to fit. This uses the same basic rules as described in the <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Capacity%2A> property. However, this does the clean-up only on the collection for this domain.

Docs.exception:
is less than or equal to zero.
-or-
is greater than the maximum allowable number of cookies instances, 300, and is not equal to ).

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetCookies (Uri uri, string cookieHeader);
.method public hidebysig instance void SetCookies(class System.Uri uri, string cookieHeader) cil managed
public: void SetCookies(Uri ^ uri, System::String ^ cookieHeader);

Docs.param: The contents of an HTTP set-cookie header as returned by a HTTP server, with instances delimited by commas.
Docs.summary: Adds instances for one or more cookies from an HTTP cookie header to the for a specific URI.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.SetCookies%2A> pulls all the HTTP cookies out of the HTTP cookie header, builds a <xref:System.Net.Cookie> for each one, and then adds each <xref:System.Net.Cookie> to the internal <xref:System.Net.CookieCollection> that is associated with the URI. The HTTP cookies in the `cookieHeader` string must be delimited by commas.

Docs.exception:
One of the cookies is invalid.
-or-
An error occurred while adding one of the cookies to the container.
